item.title: Beogram 4002 RIAA Preamplifier: First Prototype Installed
item.description:
I was tasked with creating an internal RIAA preamplifier for a restored Beogram 4002 (5521). This addition makes sense since many modern receivers lack a dedicated phono input. Additionally, the pre-opamp RIAA preamps found in many vintage B&O receivers introduce more noise compared to modern low-noise audio op-amps. Researching contemporary RIAA preamp designs led me to the LM833 operational amplifier, a specialized low-noise op-amp for audio applications. I adapted a high-precision RIAA preamp circuit from a Texas Instruments application note AN-346, as established RIAA preamplifier designs exist...

item.title: Beogram 4002 RIAA Preamplifier: A New Power Supply Design
item.description:
This post follows up on my previous one about the RIAA preamplifier I’m building for a Beogram 4002 turntable. This preamp will allow the Beogram to connect directly to a modern amplifier’s AUX or TAPE input.
